text: <@U057K5ZC81E> unfortunately the drag n drop functionality is focused on marketing emails. It is not available for Service Hub email communications.

Does anyone has working example of IF STATEMENT based on two dates and used for email module? something like:
`{% for line_item in objects.results %}`    
`{% if line_item.cbm_expiration_date < today() %}`
<@U7SL518D6> Oh thats a pitty. Do you know another solution for my case maybe?

Not specifically with date comparisons, no. But I have found sometimes storing the value in a variable first works better with if statements.

If you don’t already, you could also try the programmable email beta. It’s not super clear to me when it is or is not required, but maybe wouldn’t hurt.
I do use programable module and I did try with integer properties like qty. So it seems to be working with int but not with dates :(((
Does `today()` output the date in the same format as your data?
I did try to format it to the same format the other date  but it doesn’t work e.g.  {{today() | format_date(‘M/d/YY’)}}
Have you tried testing to see if comparing your data to a static date, instead of `today()`, works?
but what is interesting that if I try to format this line_item.cbm_expiration_date it returns error and nothing comes into module… The property I use is definately datepicker
is cbm_expiration_date a Date property or a DateTime?
...though I suppose it doesn't matter if you already spent 2 days heh.
